# Community Assessment and Parole Supervision Tender Opportunity

## Tender Notification

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) is soliciting proposals for the provision of community assessment and parole supervision services. This advance contract award notice (ACAN) seeks to establish a contract with a pre-identified supplier for the delivery of these services.

## Contract Description

The CSC requires a contractor to provide community assessment and parole supervision services for offenders on conditional release and those subject to Long-Term Supervision Orders (LTSO). The contractor will be responsible for conducting supervision visits, gathering information, and reporting back to the CSC.

## Key Responsibilities

* Conduct community assessments and parole supervision visits
* Gather information on offenders through interviews and reports
* Conduct risk assessments and provide recommendations for release conditions
* Develop and implement community strategies for offenders
* Provide regular reports to the CSC on offender progress and any issues or concerns

## Requirements

* The contractor must have 1 year of experience working in the criminal justice system and 1 year of experience providing case management services to at-risk populations
* The contractor must be able to work with offenders in a group setting and provide individualized support
* The contractor must have a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and approved Document Safeguarding Capability at the level of PROTECTED B

## Tender Details

* Tender closing date: September 10, 2023
* Tender documents: Available on the Canada Business Network website
* Contact: Katie Simpson, 801BidSubmissions@csc-scc.gc.ca

## Pre-Identified Suppliers

* Leanne Cameron
* Fraser Dodd
* Steven McDonald 

These suppliers are pre-identified as being capable of delivering the services required. However, other suppliers who believe they have the necessary experience and qualifications are invited to submit a statement of capabilities by the tender closing date. The statement must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the requirements and can deliver the services. 

## Contract Value

The contract value will depend on the services required and will be negotiated with the successful supplier. ## Important Dates

* September 10, 2023: Tender closing date
* October 1, 2023: Expected start date for the contract
* September 30, 2024: Expected end date for the contract
